question_text: What is a common reason for using a USB to DB9 adapter in modern IT environments?
answer_options: To extend HDMI signal over Ethernet
To connect a USB printer to a console port
To interface legacy serial devices with computers lacking serial ports
To convert analog video to digital signal
correct_answer: To interface legacy serial devices with computers lacking serial ports
explanation: Many modern laptops and desktops no longer include DB9 serial ports, so USB-to-DB9 adapters are used to access legacy hardware.
